settings.content:
Womens carbon road bikes tailored to your measurements. Remote Tailored Sizing and UK assembly set your contact points; you choose groupset, wheels, and 130+ paint finishes for a truly unique build. Race-tested frames trusted by elite riders worldwide.

FREE PAINT - Order before 31st January to get free paint (applies to Handsling colour palette only).

settings.title: Promote a product or a temporary offer

Learn how Handsling can personalise your bike to your performance needs.
Sized To You
settings.content: Unisex frames, women-specific fit. Remote tailored sizing sets stack/reach and contact points to your measurements before a single part is ordered.

settings.title: Tailored To You
settings.content: Choose drivetrain, wheel depth, tyre width, cockpit and finish. A bespoke women’s carbon road bike, UK-assembled and quality-checked to your spec.

settings.title: Engineered for Performance
settings.content: In-house aerodynamic shaping, internal routing and disc-brake control on UCI-approved frames for stable, all-weather pace.

settings.title: The Handsling Difference
Performance & Riding Experience
settings.content:
• Hold speed efficiently: D-shaped aero profiles and hidden routing reduce drag for real-world pace.
  • Clean power delivery: Oversized head tube, down tube and BB area enhance power transfer during big efforts. 
  • Confident, predictable handling: Composed through descents and corners; suited to crits, climbs and long endurance rides.
  • Comfort you can sustain: Refined lay-up and clearance up to 32mm tyres help cut road buzz without dulling response.

settings.title: Frame Design & Manufacture
settings.content:
• In-house design, UCI-approved: Geometry, stiffness and ride feel controlled by Handsling; cleared for racing.
  • Carbon fibre construction: Toray T800 carbon fibre frame for a balance of low mass, strength and durability.
  • EPS internal moulding: Latex-wrapped forms increase compaction for a lighter, stiffer structure with a clean internal finish.
  • Force management: Asymmetric fork and chainstays help resist disc-brake forces and pedalling loads for power transfer and stability under braking.
  • Bottom bracket standard: BB86 press-fit chosen for high stiffness.
  • Proven durability: Lab testing beyond ISO with 500,000+ fatigue cycles.

settings.title: Bike Customisation
settings.content:
• Fit-first spec: We confirm stack/reach, bar width, crank length and saddle height before parts are chosen.
  • Drivetrain choices: 1x/2x gear shifting from Shimano, SRAM or Campagnolo (subject to availability).
  • Wheels & tyres: Depths to suit terrain and goals; tyre options up to 32mm for comfort and grip.
  • Cockpit & finishing kit: Racing handlebars/stem sizes matched to your measurements; bar tape, saddle and bike accessories agreed at sign-off.
  • Finish: 130+ paint options to create a distinctive build, UK-assembled and quality checked by our expert team.

settings.title: Customer Service
settings.content:
• Direct access to specialists: Speak with the Handsling team from enquiry to handover – cyclists building for cyclists.
  • UK assembly & QC: Built and checked in Hampshire; clear updates from sizing to delivery.
  • Aftercare that lasts: Ongoing support for setup, servicing, upgrades and position tweaks as your riding evolves.
  • Limited lifetime frame warranty: Long-term confidence on a platform proven in competition.

settings.title: The A1R0evo: Carbon Road Bike for Women
settings.content:
The A1R0evo is a carbon fibre road bike engineered and UK-assembled around your fit. Its lightweight frame blends aerodynamic tube shaping with efficiency and comfort, while every detail – from groupset and wheels to paint – is yours to define. Proven by elite racers worldwide, it’s a road bike for women who want speed they can hold and handling they can trust.

Your Fit. Your Spec. Your A1R0evo.

Lock your position, choose the build, and we’ll handle the rest.

settings.author: Road.cc on the Handsling A1R0evo Shimano Ultegra Di2 R8100
settings.content: A high-end, no-compromise road bike that delivers stiffness and comfort in equal measure." 9/10
Great quality frameset which is outstanding to ride. Speed & comfort rarely come together on a road bike but my A1R0evo has it mastered.
It's fast in racing, but also handles really well, which is important when I’m cornering in a criterium or road race.
Stiff, nimble and really quick, yet more than comfortable... that frame is seriously top! All the set up was spot on; using 28’s tyres perfect for the gnarly Yorkshire tarmac
The bike is super smooth but also has really sharp handling and just feels fast.

settings.title: Lower frame weight at matched stiffness
settings.content: T1100 lay-up uses less material for the same rigidity.

settings.title: Quicker on climbs and repeats
settings.content: Less mass helps on long ascents and repeated accelerations.

settings.title: Same proven handling, lighter feel
settings.content: Identical geometry/moulds to A1R0evo.

settings.title: Spec flexibility
settings.content: Lets you keep a robust race build (wheels/tyres) while trimming frame weight.

settings.title: The A1R0evoS: Womens Carbon Road Bike
settings.content:
A lighter take on our flagship: A1R0evoS pairs a refined Toray T1100 carbon fibre frame with clean aerodynamic tube shaping and a fit set to you. UK-assembled and proven by athletes in women’s cycling, it delivers clear handling and sustainable speed for road biking.

Your Fit. Less Weight. Same Control.

A lighter carbon fibre frame, a position you can hold, and a spec that fits your roads.

settings.content: Fast corners, repeated efforts, no margin for error. On the A1R0evo, precision road biking met race-day control as the team executed a textbook finish to claim the British Circuit Race Championship. A tailored position, smart gear shifting choices and a responsive chassis kept speed high from whistle to sprint.

settings.content: Short reads showing how a custom-fit Handsling womens carbon road bike translates to winning results in national-level racing.

settings.text: Test Ride a Womens Road Bike

settings.content: Book a test ride today at Handsling's UK factory. Or schedule a video call with the sales team.

settings.title: What is the best Handsling road bike for ladies?
settings.content:
It comes down to your priorities:

  • A1R0evo – best if you want an all-round performer for club rides, sportives and racing on rough UK roads. Same race-proven geometry, Toray T800 lay-up, tyre clearance up to 32mm, and great scope for upgrades. Ideal if you value versatility, comfort over distance, and balanced handling at a sensible weight.
  • A1R0evoS – best if you’re chasing every marginal gram for hillier routes, punchy accelerations or lighter overall feel. Identical geometry but a T1100 lay-up achieves the same stiffness with less material, so climbs and repeated efforts feel easier while handling stays composed.

We’ll set your position via Remote Tailored Sizing first, then recommend the frame and spec (gearing, wheels, cockpit) that fit your goals and budget.

settings.title: What is the best womens road bike for beginners?
settings.content: Start with a carbon bike set to a sustainable position: sensible bar width, appropriate crank length, 28-30 mm tyres, and gearing you can turn comfortably. The Handsling A1R0evo is an ideal foundation – fit it to you first, then choose a groupset and wheels you can upgrade later as your riding grows.

settings.title: What makes a womens carbon road bike different from a unisex build?
settings.content: At Handsling, every carbon road bike frame is unisex – the difference is the fit. We use the same UCI-approved carbon platforms and tailor stack/reach, bar width, stem, crank length, saddle choice/height and lever reach to your measurements and flexibility. The result feels women-specific because it’s built around your position, not a generic size chart.

settings.title: an you match an existing fit from another womens road bike?
settings.content: Yes. Share measurements from your existing bike or your Bike Fit report and we’ll replicate or refine them during Remote Tailored Sizing. We’ll confirm bar width, stem length, handlebar height, and saddle layback before UK assembly.

settings.title: What handlebar width choices must be considered for female cyclists?
settings.content: Use shoulder width as a guide, then consider reach and drop that you can hold for long rides. Many riders land between 36-40 cm, but we size case-by-case and can spec shorter-reach bars or adjust hood angle and lever reach for smaller hands.

settings.title: How should a bike fit a woman?
settings.content: Comfortable, repeatable posture first: stack/reach set to maintain even weight distribution; saddle height and setback for effective pedal stroke; bar width and lever reach for secure braking in hoods and drops. We confirm these in sizing, then build your womens carbon road bike to those coordinates.

settings.title: Are your womens carbon road bikes available through Cycle to Work or finance schemes in the UK?
settings.content: Yes. We support Cycle to Work schemes and finance options on eligible bikes and framesets. During your quotation we’ll confirm providers and limits, then prepare the paperwork so you can order through your employer.

settings.title: What is the lead time for a custom road bike for women?
settings.content: Our bespoke women’s road bikes typically take 6-8 weeks, depending on paint choice and component availability. We size first, agree the spec, book the paint slot, then assemble and quality-check in our Hampshire, UK factory. If you have a deadline, we’ll suggest in-stock options to keep timings tight.

settings.title: Can I visit your UK factory for a test ride?
settings.content: Yes. You can book a fitting/consultation and test ride at our Hampshire facility, or complete Remote Tailored Sizing from home. To arrange a visit, email sales@handslingbikes.com or call 01420 612700.

settings.title: Frequently Asked Questions
settings.content:
Learn about Handsling bikes and what separates us from the competition. For questions on ordering, delivery, maintenance, and much more, go to our support centre.

If you're looking beyond the road, explore carbon fibre gravel bikes, track bikes, TT bikes and triathlon bikes.
